intro: Phagnalon yerrimense, commonly known as the Yerrimena phagnalon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It features small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Phagnalon yerrimense is often found in open woodlands and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and possibly medicinal significance.
